project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a user of plain Jira and Greenhopper, I would expect the same list of issue operations in all Greenhopper boards that are also shown in plain Jira. I would expect that the same operation conditions are respected by Greenhopper that are used by plain Jira, even if these conditions are customized. This would 
* lead to a better integration of Jira and Greenhopper, 
* avoid the need to switch between both,
* would allow easier customization of conditions (one change - everywhere respected)

Technically, Greenhopper should do the same as the plain Jira navigator does for each issue to determine available operations (and transitions). Even the UI should be similar (e.g. no need for a "More Actions..." popup).
fields.summary: Greenhopper should show the same issue operations on boards as plain Jira does

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When initially using the marker time values always display in 'Pretty' format *d, *h, *m. 

This is a bug because if the JIRA time format is set to just 'Hours' or 'Days' it should use that format. 

But there is a further bug. When you open Report mode then return to the Plan mode the marker will then display just a number of hours (for example 150h). A reload is required to fix this.
fields.summary: Time values on marker displayed in hours after open of other mode, instead of normal JIRA format: *d, *h, *m

fields.summary: Epics and Themes in Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-5576].
  {panel}

The visibility of Rapid Boards is based on the Shares of a filter. If a JIRA administrator shall do some changes in a Rapid Board configuration, he is only able to do so, if he is somehow included in the Share of the filter. 

This isn't the optimal in all cases.
- When using cross-project Rapid Boards, with the filter shared with a user group, but with the user group normally not including any JIRA administrators. That means that the Rapid Board is not visible to the JIRA admin and therefore the owner of the Rapid Board is the only one who can do configure the board. 
- When the board owner or one of the admins changes the board filter to a private one, they lock all other admins out of it. Neither JIRA admins nor users that are Board administrators cannot access the board because of the missing filter share.

That should be changes, so that a JIRA admin can see and configure all Rapid Boards, even if he is not included in the Shares of a filter. Alternatively, the "Board administrator" setting should override the filter share settings.
fields.summary: As a (board) administrator I'd like to access the board regardless of the filter shares

fields.description:
When getting familiar with the Rapid Board for Scrum, it can be confusing that the 'Start Sprint' button is disabled when a current sprint is In Progress.

Please add a click or hover action for the button that informs users that they can only start the sprint once the in-progress sprint is completed. Bonus points for indicating HOW to complete the in-progress sprint!

I've updated [Starting a Sprint|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Starting+a+Sprint] to highlight this, but it would be ideal if users don't have to consult our documentation.
fields.summary: Why can't I start my Sprint? Help users learn within the UI

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
COS: 
- Detect when page loses focus and stop doing this so regularly 

(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: How often does this poll? Can the user define this polling interval?
A: 30 sec. No, user can't define interval

Q: What if there was a change, then another change to undo that change? aka there is no effective delta?
A: The client side will receive the updated data and then decide its already up to date, thus ignore it

Q: What if the user has been logged out?
A: Thanks to Jason a separate logic automatically redirects to the login page when an ajax request fails due to being logged out. This works for all requests, be it filter change, detail view, or update poller. The question here probably is whether the update poller should really trigger this redirect...

Q: What if the user does not have permission to see the board? Do they still get notifications?
A: Why would the board open if they had no permission

Q: Any conflict if there was an error on the page as well?
A: Not handled

Q: Is there a way for a user to disable these notifications?
A: No

Q: Any conflict if I have multiple boards open in multiple tabs?
A: Should not. Each board will separately poll for updates though
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like the board to poll for staleness and provide a notification if there are changes at a sane interval

fields.description:
Hi Rosie, 

This comment (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Tutorial+-+Planning+and+Estimating+work+for+an+Agile+team?focusedCommentId=297665474#comment-297665474) seems reasonable (you have probably already seen it):

"As a new Greenhopper user, there seems to be a big assumption that I already know or have configured JIRA - specifically, I have not idea how to create my team. Where do I add team members?  I guess that's a JIRA thing, there's not info in the GreenHopper 101. There should at least be a reference with a link - "Go here to learn how to set up your team"."

Could we do this?  

Thanks

fields.description:
If you have the following scenario:

- Task 1 (assignee user 1)
- sub-task 1 (assignee user 2)
- sub-task 2 (assignee user 3)

- Task 2 (assignee user 1)
- sub-task 3 (assignee user 2)
- sub-task 4 (assignee user 3)

If you create a Rapid board and base the swimlanes on Assignees, it is not possible to rank the sub-tasks (send sub-task 2 above sub-task 1 or sub-task 3 below sub-task 4).
fields.summary: Cannot rank subtasks from different assignees on Rapid Board (work mode) when basing swimlanes on assigness

fields.description:
I use a MacBook with a touchpad during planning meetings.
It happens all the time that instead of scrolling the view I start dragging some random card and drop it in random places.

As there is no Undo functionality, or graphical indication of what I just dragged and from where, I think it would be much better to restrict dragging to those dotty few-pixel colorful strips that look just like drag handles, and don't allow dragging from the whole area of the card.

Fortunatelly Esc key seems to do the right thing if you notice what is happening and press it before the card is dropped in the new location.
fields.summary: Please make it harder to accidentally reorder stories when looking at the Sprint Plan view

fields.description:
(!) Testing Notes (!)

Q: How many sprints can be open at once?
A: No limit

Q: Is there any impact on reporting when multiple sprints are active?
A: (x) Not answered

Q: How do we know which report to jump to when juggling sprints in work mode?
A: (x) Not answered

Q: What happens when an active sprint is closed by some other user while you are working on it?
A: (x) Not answered

Q: What if i want to view different swimlane strategies in each of my active sprints?
A: Raise a feature request

Q: What happens when all issues are removed from an active sprint?
A: Existing problem, iirc there's an open bug to better handle this

Q: What if all issues from one sprint are moved to another active sprint?
A: As above

Q: Do we still jump to reports if an active sprint is still open?
A: (x) Not answered

fields.description:
This is both a problem that I have and a limitation of the platform that does not allows me to setup the color of my cards for the Rapid Board.

However, as a feature, we are also locked up to "recover" the possibility of having a "red" (which I think is very important) card on the rapid board, unadvertedly.

Either an option to recover the "system issue types" (which would be more related to JIRA than to GHS, or a very simple feature to set the "default" colors of issue types that would reflect on the GreenHooper Rapid Board.
fields.summary: If you remove the issue type bug from your on-demand Atlassian, because the rapid board cards colors are not configurable, you can never have "red" coloured cards again (no way to include it back)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
According to https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/6569/how-do-you-burndown-story-points-in-greenhopper-on-a-daily-basis, Rapid board burn down is determined by the rightmost column on the rapid board, this should be change to be a configurable column specified by the user.

The reason for this is that right most columns might include QA/testing activities, that do not effectively represent development burn down,  
resulting in skewed burn down charts.
fields.summary: Rapid board burndown determiner

fields.description:
We would like to improve integration of our plugin Structure with GreenHopper. One thing that the users ask from us frequently is "we don't see the context of a given issue on the Rapid Board" - meaning, that you can't see the issue's position in a structure without visiting the issue page.

It would be great if GreenHopper provided an extension point that would allow us to add another tab on the issue preview panel. We would place a structure widget on that tab so the user can switch and see the structure pertaining to that issue without leaving Rapid Board.

When attempting to install GreenHopper 5.10.5.1 in an installation that was just upgraded in-place from Jira 5.0.3 and GH 5.10.5, I received the error message "Could not find a handler capable of installing the plugin at jira-greenhopper-plugin-5.10.5.1.jar. Check that the file is a valid plugin."
THe following error appeared in the atlassian-jira.log file:
2012-07-25 08:45:34,328 pool-14-thread-3 ERROR (username) 525x762x1 1r4a4pl 172.28.161.123,172.28.163.30 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [com.atlassian.upm.PluginInstaller] File 'jira-greenhopper-plugin-5.10.5.1.jar' is not a valid plugin: Could not open the file as a jar

After that, I downloaded the file again and tried the following using Java 6 on my PC:
C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\download\atlassian>jar -tvf jira-greenhopper-plugin-5.10.5.1.jar
java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method)
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(ZipFile.java:127)
        at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(ZipFile.java:88)
        at sun.tools.jar.Main.list(Main.java:979)
        at sun.tools.jar.Main.run(Main.java:224)
        at sun.tools.jar.Main.main(Main.java:1149)

C:\Documents and Settings\username\My Documents\download\atlassian>md5sum jira-greenhopper-plugin-5.10.5.1.jar
d6eca771bef25552349f189ae7eb7821 *jira-greenhopper-plugin-5.10.5.1.jar

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When JIRA is behind the firewall and if the Greenhopper feedback module is enabled it throws javascript exceptions. This could be handled as a feature to have a global configuration which indicates to JIRA that internet connection should not be attempted (including UPM probably).

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as at 28th August 2012| borderStyle=solid| borderColor=#ccc| titleBGColor=#49BD5F| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
We hardened this code in GreenHopper 5.10.6 so that most users should not see errors of this sort. 

We've further hardened the code in the forthcoming GreenHopper 6.0.2. Once GreenHopper 6.0.2 is released all users will be able to upgrade to this version and be assured these errors are resolved. 

Thank you.

Regards,
Shaun Clowes
{panel}
fields.summary: Greenhopper Feedback Behind Firewall

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
See GHS-4951 for context. GHS-4951 introduced a fix with the intent to solve the problem, but the problem has not been solved for all use cases.

We hit the following behaviour at least three times: Using quick filter to remove issues from view, and dragging a visible issue above the sprint marker, seems to drag many other issues as well - presumedly the issues between the two visible issues.

This is not intuitive behaviour, and the damage can be significant. In our first case - somebody incorrectly used a filter and managed to include 600+ unrelated issues into their sprint. In the second case - I was demonstrating the new rapid board to internal customers, and even though we were trying to be careful by not moving the sprint marker (as we suspected that the original user had done) - and when clearing the filter, suddenly many issues appeared above the sprint marker as well. In the third case it also represents in hours of lost time to fix the damage.

Dragging one issue above the sprint marker is not intuitive to result in many issues being moved above the sprint marker. Can you re-open and look into this?

We have GreenHopper 5.10.3 deployed.

I recommend either:

1) Blocking the behaviour. At least this will eliminate the surprise factor and the risk of damage.

2) Re-ordering the issues to allow the issue to be moved into the scrum without also including the invisible in between issues. I understand that there is a concern that this behaviour is magical - however, I think the magic is exactly what users want to see, and they would prefer to re-rank the visible issues in committed over accidentally committing to dozens or hundreds of stories.
fields.summary: Using quick filter and rapid board sprint planning together allows for many invisible issues to be accidentally committed.

fields.description:
These should be broken into subtasks as they are handled.


* Fix scrolling in the details view when scrolled down in the view. It's a bit painful at the moment.
* Presentation mode button at the top when in iPad mode.
* More actions button at the top when in iPad mode.
* Plan mode:
** We can speed up the change handler on the issue element drag by removing it! At the moment we have a change handler applied globally and then on receiving the event create a jQuery object for the element, and if it has a issue class throw it away. Instead, we can bind the change handler for the marker class only, and avoid this work.
** We can speed up the marker change handler through performing a check on current issue position vs. old issue position, and doing an incremental update. This would depend on a issue key -> issue position map, I think we have one already?
fields.summary: iPad improvements

Is there anywhere else we could put this that would get Google attention? Could we maybe have a FAQ?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This is more an improvement request than a bug, but from a REST API perspective this is incorrect.

We currently return 401 Unauthorised errors from REST calls when either a user is not authenticated or when a user is not permitted to do something. [This page|http://stackoverflow.com/a/6937030] outlines the distinction between 401 and 403.

We should update our code to serve 403 errors for things such as failed permissions.
fields.summary: GreenHopper Web Exceptions do not differentiate between Unauthorised and Forbidden

fields.description:
When you've scrolled down any amount at all on the Rapid Board and you attempt to drag an issue card, the issue card's position is offset from the cursor.  The position of the issue card seems relative to the top of the page not the viewport.

Eg. If you've scrolled down 40px, and you attempt to drag a card, the card appears 40px higher than cursor when being dragged.  If you've scrolled 1 viewport's height down the card isn't visible at all.  But dragging and dropping still works properly even though you can't see the card (it uses cursor position).

Haven't noticed this before when I was using Safari on Snow Leopard. Bug doesn't manifest itself in Chrome.
fields.summary: Incorrect position when Dragging & Dropping Issues Cards in Rapid Board on Safari on Lion [Version 5.1.6 (7534.56.5)]

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When planning a SCRUM sprint across multiple projects (using the new Rapid-board), it would be very nice to be able to highlight issues related to the different projects, similar to what can be done in the Agile Task Board today. The Highlight feature could be based on filters, similar to the Quick Filter functionality, but instead of filtering out and only showing the issues that match the filter, it would be more practical to filter by highlighting the issues matching the filter.
The reason for this is that when prioritizing the backlog, I need to prioritize issues across projects. If I use the QuickFilters today to only see issues from one specific project, and then start to reorganize the order of the issues, I have no control of how the reordering affects the other projects. By leaving all issues in the list and just highlighting the issues belonging to one filter, I will still be able to maintain control of the order also between the projects.
fields.summary: As a SCRUM user (PO) doing cross-project sprint planning with the RapidBoard, I would like to be able to highlight issues based on filtering

I believe this should be possible by tracking the virtual status in another hidden custom field similar to the Sprint field.
fields.summary: Virtual Status Columns in Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Parent issue without estimate is not showing sub-task's estimate in the rapid board plan mode.
Currently, it's difficult to have the real total estimates for a sprint or somehow will cause confusion for users to plan ahead for next sprint.


h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a Software Project.
# Create an issue.
# Create a sub-task from the issue, set *original estimate* to 3w.
# Observe the parent issue, the Time Tracking is showing 3w as original estimate and remaining if the option to include sub-tasks is selected.
#  !parentIssue.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a board for this project.
# Configure the board to estimate the issues in the Backlog using *Original Time Estimate* and *Track time against issues using JIRA's Remaining Estimate and Time Spent fields*
# Go back to the board, choose to *show detail view*
# Click on the parent issue


h3. Expected result

The original estimate should show the total estimate for both the parent and sub task.


h3. Actual result

The original estimate is showing _unestimated_.
 !unestimated.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Suggestion

Parent issue without estimate should include its sub-task's estimates in rapid board plan mode since the sub-tasks are not shown in the issue details.
fields.summary: Parent issue without estimate should provide its subtasks estimates in rapid board plan mode

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When trying to change the owner of a rapid board, no username will ever be recognized. Even the current owners username comes up with the message "No Match".

We have tried user names, full names, even group names. There is no way for us to change the owner.

Our system uses LDAP, which works for every other area within the administration pages, but it is as if Rapid Boards can't access LDAP users when trying to change an owner.

Basically, for us it right now means that once a Rapid board is created it is always owned by that user, which makes it impossible to administer after a user is no longer involved in a project.
fields.summary: Unable to change owner of Rapid Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to be able to start a sprint with a start date specified in the past.

This was a problem for us because we neglected to start the sprint in GreenHopper when the sprint actually started, so I wanted to retrospectively start it. (This happened because we did the sprint planning and acceptance whilst the previous sprint was ongoing, and GreenHopper won't allow us to specify the next sprint without ending the current one. By the time the next sprint started, we forgot to start it in GreenHopper. (We're new to using GreenHopper in our scrum process :-) ) I believe multiple sprints is a feature that is being planned for a future GreenHopper release?)
fields.summary: Allow sprint start date in past

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When adding an issue after the start date of a sprint, the duration of the issue is not added to the global remaining time of the project in the Hour Burndown Chart, when there's no worklog on the issue.
After the first wokrlog (or if there was already a worklog on the issue), the estimated time of the issue is then added to the times of the sprint. 

To replicate: 
Create 3 issue A, B and C, each of 1 day estimated time.
Add a worklog on issue B only.
Create a new version and start a new sprint with issue A. 
The estimated time and the remaining time are 1 day, it's ok.
At day 2 of sprint, add issue B and C to the sprint. 
Open Hour Burndown Chart. The estimated time and the remaining time are 2 days, should be 3.
Open issue C, add a worklog of 1 minute
Open Hour Burndown Chart : the remaining and estimated time are now correct.
fields.summary: Hour Burndown Chart displays false remaining time

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Hello team,

We've discovered, after an user reported a performance issue, that some threads on GreenHopper aren't using a synchronized protection, which means that we can have data inconsistency or infinite loops caused by multiple threads accessing a share resource.

On a specific case, the customer was able to track that a thread of com.pyxis.greenhopper.GreenHopperImpl.put method was stuck. Also, as per his comments:

{quote}
Therefore, I conclude that the HashMap is being improperly accessed. I checked the code - and sure enough - if you track the stack backwards from the put() higher, I see no use of synchronization primitives. No thread safety. 18 threads are locked in a put() against a non-thread-safe data structure. Something is wrong.

The consequence of improper access are varied and random as they depend on the exact assumptions that each thread is making about cached data. One possible outcome can be a regular loop accessing the data structure turns into an infinite loop due to a "circular" reference, because of incorrect assumptions that the JVM is making about the data it is accessing.
{quote}

Could you please consider this and tell us if this is possible to implement a protection on running threads?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Implement use of synchronized threads on shared data structures
